alert.note: Alert for Clay; Knox; Laurel; McCreary; Pulaski; Wayne; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 22 at 2:41AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall possible. * WHERE...Portions of east central Kentucky, northeast Kentucky, south central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in east central Kentucky, Bath, Elliott, Estill, Fleming, Menifee, Montgomery, Powell and Rowan. In northeast Kentucky, Johnson and Martin. In south central Kentucky, Laurel, McCreary, Pulaski, Rockcastle, Wayne and Whitley. In southeast Kentucky, Bell, Breathitt, Clay, Floyd, Harlan, Jackson, Knott, Knox, Lee, Leslie, Letcher, Magoffin, Morgan, Owsley, Perry, Pike and Wolfe. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A slow-moving cold front will bring widespread rain to eastern Kentucky today through late tonight. The rain could be heavy at times. At this time, 1.5 to 3 inches of rainfall is forecast to fall. Should these rainfall amounts materialize, flooding of some creeks and streams will be likely. Rises to near or past bankfull along rivers would also be possible.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Knox; Laurel; McCreary; Pulaski; Wayne; Whitley
